FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Policy. The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Fertilizer are committed to the preventionof any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared towork with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and impact of the release to persons and the environment.
2. Facility Information. Trotter Fertilizer is a small independant retail facility for plant food and crop protection chemicals. Crop protection products are in sealed containers and are sold and distributed to the farm.
3. The worst -case release and the alternative release scenarios:
   a.The worst-case release scenario would release of the total contents of the storage tank over a ten minute period. The distance to the endpoint would be 3.3 miles.
    b. Thr alternative release scenario would be the break of a transfer  hose. the distance to the endpoint would be .3 miles
4. Accidental Release Prevention Program: The facility has implemented the provisions of OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.1200, Hazard Communication.
5.Five-year Accident History; There have been no reportable accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years.
6. Emergency Responce Program; The "Emergency Action Plan" of Trotter Fertilizer describes procedures to minimize hazards to human health and to the environment from sudden releases and non-sudden relwases of chemicals. Copies of the well organized easy to use color codes. Plans have been distributed to the Local Emergency PLanning Committee, Fire Department, and two strategic locations at the facility. Our employee are aware of the provisions of the emergency action plan and each one's role in carring out the plan. An ongoing safety training and acceident prevention programs is our first line of defense.
7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety; Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility. periodic evaluations are performed to acess the maintenance and safe

conditions of our equipment. There are no additional specific andhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.
8. For further Information contact John  Felton at (308) 728-7722
